content: bulky beginner s hat by maggie billings skill level finished size 19 5 unstretched circumference 8 5 total height fits adult head size about 21-23 /53-58 5cm gauge 13 sts x 19 row = 4 /10cm in stockinette stitch materials ● brown sheep lamb s pride bulky 125 yds/114m 4oz/113g 85% wool 15% mohair 1 skein ● us size 10 6mm circular knitting needles with a 16 cable or size needed to obtain gauge ● us size 10 6mm double-pointed needles or size needed to obtain gauge ● stitch markers ● measuring tape or ruler ● tapestry needle for weaving in ends abbreviations bor beginning of the round p purl co cast on pm place stitch marker dpn double pointed needles round round k knit st/sts stitch/stitches k2tog knit two stitches together as if ** instructions between asterisks will they were one stitch be repeated for all of the stitches in the round instructions cast on co 65 stitches using the long-tail cast on being careful not to twist the stitches join to work in the round by knitting the first stitch you cast on together with the last stitch cast on you now have 64 sts place a marker pm here to mark the beginning of the round bor ⓒ may 2022 margaret billings 1 brim knit the first stitch purl the next stitch repeat this pattern to work k1 p1 ribbing for 1 5 /3 75cm body once the ribbing is complete knit every stitch of every row stockinette stitch for 4 5 /11 5cm your entire project will now measure 6 /16 25cm from the co edge crown shaping begin decreasing to make the crown of the hat as follows switching from a circular needle to dpn s as the circumference of the hat gets too small for the circular needles each odd-numbered round will reduce the total stitches on your needles by 8 creating a spiral pattern every even-numbered round will be knit without decreasing after round 2 only odd-numbered rounds are written out all even-numbered rounds will be knit like round 2 fill in the box by each round after you ve completed it to keep track of where you are round 1 *k6 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 56 stitches left round 2 knit all stitches round 3 *k5 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 48 stitches left round 5 *k4 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 40 stitches left round 7 *k3 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 32 stitches left round 9 *k2 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round 24 stitches left round 11 *k1 k2tog* repeat to the end of the round you should now have 16 stitches total round 12 k2tog all the way around leaving 8 stitches cut the yarn leaving a 10 tail to finish with thread the end of the tail through a tapestry needle while keeping the stitches on the needles thread the tail through
